response.body:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>
<sparql xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2005/sparql-results#'>
	<head>
		<variable name='s'/>
		<variable name='name'/>
		<variable name='hint'/>
	</head>
	<results>
		<result>
			<binding name='s'>
				<uri>http://vocab.getty.edu/ulan/500221352</uri>
			</binding>
			<binding name='name'>
				<literal>McKim, Mead and Bigelow</literal>
			</binding>
			<binding name='hint'>
				<literal xml:lang='en'>American architectural partnership, New York City, 1878-1879.</literal>
			</binding>
		</result>
		<result>
			<binding name='s'>
				<uri>http://vocab.getty.edu/ulan/500019204</uri>
			</binding>
			<binding name='name'>
				<literal xml:lang='en'>McKim, Charles Follen</literal>
			</binding>
			<binding name='hint'>
				<literal xml:lang='en'>American architect.</literal>
			</binding>
		</result>
		<result>
			<binding name='s'>
				<uri>http://vocab.getty.edu/ulan/500122312</uri>
			</binding>
			<binding name='name'>
				<literal>McKim, Mead, and White</literal>
			</binding>
			<binding name='hint'>
				<literal xml:lang='en'>American architectural firm formed in 1879 by Charles Follen McKim (1847-1909), William Rutherford Mead (1846-1928), and Stanford White (1853-1906).By the 1880's they were one of the leading proponents of classical revival as an expression of national architectural identity. Mead remained technically a part of the firm until his official retirement in 1919. </literal>
			</binding>
		</result>
		<result>
			<binding name='s'>
				<uri>http://vocab.getty.edu/ulan/500587200</uri>
			</binding>
			<binding name='name'>
				<literal xml:lang='en'>McKim, Musa</literal>
			</binding>
			<binding name='hint'>
				<literal xml:lang='en'>Known as poet, painter, and a muralist for the Works Progress Administration (WPA) during the Great Depression; McKim served as a model for many of her husband's figurative paintings, especially in his later period</literal>
			</binding>
		</result>
		<result>
			<binding name='s'>
				<uri>http://vocab.getty.edu/ulan/500229650</uri>
			</binding>
			<binding name='name'>
				<literal>Norton, Charles McKim</literal>
			</binding>
			<binding name='hint'>
				<literal xml:lang='en'>American architect and city planner; former president of the Regional Plan Association, died May 10. American city planner; president of the Regional Plann Association from 1940 to 1969.</literal>
			</binding>
		</result>
	</results>
</sparql>
